questions.question: What is the event-driven, non-blocking I/O model used in Node.js called?
Which core module of Node.js is used to create a web server?
What is the purpose of the `require()` function in Node.js?
Which Node.js module is used for reading and writing files?
What does the term 'npm' stand for in Node.js?
What is the role of the event loop in Node.js?
options: It manages callbacks and asynchronous tasks
It handles file system operations asynchronously
questions.answer: It manages callbacks and asynchronous tasks

questions.question: Which method is used to handle asynchronous operations in Node.js?
What is the purpose of the `process` global object in Node.js?
Which Node.js framework is commonly used for building web applications?
What is the purpose of the `module.exports` object in Node.js?
options: To export functions or objects from a module
To import modules from external files
questions.answer: To export functions or objects from a module
